page.title: 11OLDHAM EDGE
page.content: WE MADE SEVERAL FIELD TRIPS TO OLDHAM EDGE AND WALKED FROM THE CROMPTON STREET BOUNDARY TO OLD EDGE LANE.WE SURVEYED THE PLANT AND ANIMAL LIFE OF THE EDGE.WE FOUND THE FOLLOWING WILD FLOWERS GROWING THERE:DAISES,CLOVER,CREEPING BUTTERCUP,ROSEBAY WILLOWHERB AND THISTLES.WE FOUND FLOWERLESS PLANTS CALLED FERNS,DOCKS AND PLANTAINS.WHERE THE LAND WAS MARSHY,WE FOUND BEARDMOSS,SPHAGNUM MOSS,REEDS AND HORSETAILS.IN THE STREAM THERE WERE FROGS,DIVING BEETLES,POND SKATERS AND WATER BOATMEN.THE GRASSES ON OLDHAM EDGE INCLUDED HARE'S TAIL,FOXTAIL AND MEADOW GRASS.SOME YOUNG TREES HAD BEEN PLANTED IN SEVERAL AREAS.THESE INCLUDED SYCAMORE,HAWTHORN,ACER,SILVER BIRCH,BEACH,WILLOW, ALDER AND LARCH BIRDS INCLUDED SKYLARKS,LAPWINGS,MAGPIES,SPARROWHALK.
